context: A security incident revealed possible ransomware activity due to numerous file system changes on a device, including files like `get-userprttoken.ps1`, `characterical.zip`, and `characterical.zip.lockbit`. This activity may indicate mass encryption of files by ransomware. At the same time, a related suspicious behavior involved an attempt to access the Primary Refresh Token (PRT), a crucial authentication artifact in Azure AD, which could facilitate lateral movement or credential theft within the organization.
question: What is the IP address associated with the possible attempt to access the Primary Refresh Token (PRT)?
solution_steps: Numerous file system changes have been observed and are indicative of mass encryption by ransomware on the account with SID `S-1-5-21-1840191660-8534830288-125585561-1522`.
There was a possible attempt to access the Primary Refresh Token (PRT) by the process `browsercore.exe`.
The attempt to access the Primary Refresh Token (PRT) was made from the IP address `107.224.99.179`.
